slr_test.name: Straight Leg Raise (SLR)
slr_test.instruction: Examiner raises legs of patient up so that hip flexion is achieved while knee is extended. Positive if patient feels pain along the course of the sciatic nerve (30-70 degrees).

bragard_test.name: Bragard Test
bragard_test.instruction: Modification of SLR: dorsiflexion is applied at the end of the SLR. Confirming neurogenic origin of pain.

bowstring_test.name: Bowstring Test (Popliteal Compression)
bowstring_test.instruction: Flex the knee and apply pressure on the popliteal fossa evoking sciatica.

femoral_stretch_test.name: Femoral Nerve Stretch Test
femoral_stretch_test.instruction: Patient prone, knee flexed and hip extended. Positive if pain in anterior thigh.

slump_test.name: Slump Test
slump_test.instruction: Patient slumps forward while seated, examiner dorsiflexes foot and extends knee.

diag_lumbar_disc_herniation.name: Refined Diagnosis: Lumbar Disc Herniation
diag_lumbar_disc_herniation.instruction: The provocative results strongly indicate disc herniation with nerve root involvement.

diag_sciatica.name: Refined Diagnosis: Sciatica / Neural Tension
diag_sciatica.instruction: Significant neural tension without definitive disc-level confirmation.

diag_l2_l4_compression.name: Refined Diagnosis: L2-L4 Compression
diag_l2_l4_compression.instruction: Anterior neural tension points to upper lumbar segment involvement.

diag_non_specific_lbp.name: Refined Diagnosis: Non-Specific LBP
diag_non_specific_lbp.instruction: Tests negative for neural tension. Pain likely muscular or mechanical non-specific.

diag_facet_joint.name: Refined Diagnosis: Facet Joint Syndrome
diag_facet_joint.instruction: Mechanical pattern without neural involvement suggests facetogenic origin.

painful_arc.name: Painful Arc Test
painful_arc.instruction: Active abduction of the arm. Positive if pain between 60° and 120°.

neers_test.name: Neer's Test
neers_test.instruction: Examiner stabilises scapula and passively flexes the arm to end-range.

empty_can_test.name: Empty Can Test (Jobe)
empty_can_test.instruction: Arm at 90° abduction, 30° horizontal flexion, internal rotation. Resisted elevation.

hawkins_kennedy.name: Hawkins-Kennedy Test
hawkins_kennedy.instruction: Shoulder and elbow flexed to 90°, then examiner forces internal rotation.

diag_frozen_shoulder_check.name: Passive Range of Motion Check
diag_frozen_shoulder_check.instruction: Check for significant global reduction in ROM (capsular pattern).

diag_rotator_cuff_tear.name: Refined Diagnosis: Rotator Cuff Tear
diag_rotator_cuff_tear.instruction: Positive impingement and weakness strongly support cuff pathology.

diag_subacromial_impingement.name: Refined Diagnosis: Subacromial Impingement
diag_subacromial_impingement.instruction: Positive Hawkins/Neer without significant weakness indicates impingement.

diag_adhesive_capsulitis.name: Refined Diagnosis: Adhesive Capsulitis
diag_adhesive_capsulitis.instruction: Global ROM restriction indicates Frozen Shoulder.

diag_bicipital_tendinitis.name: Refined Diagnosis: Bicipital Tendinitis
diag_bicipital_tendinitis.instruction: Mechanism and localized tenderness suggests biceps involvement.
